title: No Kings
description: We are organizing a nationwide protest at the Westmoreland County Courthouse to pressure Congress, stand up for righteousness, and advocate for the impeachment and removal of those in power if necessary. Join us to uphold justice and affirm that there are no kings in America.

NO KINGS
NATIONWIDE PROTEST
OCTOBER 18 12-2PM
WESTMORELAND COUNTY COURTHOUSE
2 NORTH MAIN ST. GREENSBURG, PA
Pressure congress to uphold justice!
There are no kings in America!
Stand up for righteousness!
Impeach, convict, REMOVE!
WWW.WTFCANIDOWESTMORELAND.ORG

The event calls to pressure Congress, stand up for righteousness, and remove those in power if necessary. The website provided is www.wtfcanidowestmoreland.org.

title: No Kings 2.0
description: The event promotes the constitutional principle that no individual should be above the law and discourages monarchy or privileges based on birth or title. Organized by LD #20 Democrats, Centralia.Mobilize, and Rural Lewis Indivisible.
address: George Washington Park Sidewalk on S. Pearl St.
raw_text:
NO KINGS 2.0

The Constitution establishes a system where no individual, including the President, is above the law and it actively discourages the establishment of a monarchy or any system that grants special privileges based on birth or title.

Join Us October 18th, 2025, 1PM to 3PM

George Washington Park Sidewalk on S. Pearl St.
Centralia, Washington

Organized by LD #20 Democrats, Centralia.Mobilize and Rural Lewis Indivisible

title: Join the Movement - No Kings
description: We invite you to join us at the Historic Cache Courthouse to revive democracy through fairness, freedom, equal rights, justice, and environmental restoration. Participants are expected to practice nonviolence.
raw_text:
POWER BELONGS TO THE PEOPLE. JOIN THE MOVEMENT
NO KINGS
SATURDAY, OCT. 18
1:00-2:30 pm
Historic Cache Courthouse
199 N Main, Logan UT 
WethePeopleCacheValley

Revive Democracy — Fairness, Freedom, Equal Rights, Justice, Restore the Earth

A core principle behind all our events is a commitment to nonviolent action. We expect all participants to seek to de-escalate any potential confrontation with those who disagree with our values. Weapons of any kind, including those legally permitted, should not be brought to events.
raw_summary: This flyer promotes a public event organized by 'We the People Cache Valley' demanding political and social change, taking place on Saturday, October 18, from 1:00 PM to 2:30 PM at the Historic Cache Courthouse, located at 199 N Main, Logan, UT. The event focuses on reviving democracy and promoting equal rights, justice, and the environment, advocating for nonviolent actions.
